event_text: During the Gathering, m_c makes an off-color comment about o_c_n's leader, much to o_c_n's shock.
During the Gathering, m_c pointedly excludes o_c_n's leader from the discussion amongst the leaders on the leader's perch.
o_c_n runs late to the Gathering, and m_c encourages the other leaders to start without them.
During the Gathering, m_c sighs loudly whenever o_c_n's leader speaks.
At the Gathering, m_c pretends to have forgotten o_c_n's leader's name, much to their disbelief.
Before the Gathering, m_c counsels {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Clan to begin cutting ties and ending friendships with o_c_n warriors. The tension hanging over this Gathering makes it clear o_c_n notices.
During {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} speech at the Gathering, m_c reveals one of o_c_n's weaknesses that o_c_n's leader told {PRONOUN/m_c/object} in confidence.
At the Gathering, m_c flatly ignores o_c_n's leader when they try to make small-talk.
m_c barges in front of o_c_n's leader at the Gathering, cutting them off and insisting that m_c be the first to deliver news.
At the Gathering, m_c questions whether o_c_n's leader has been entirely truthful about their recent activities on their shared border.
During the Gathering, m_c keeps talking over o_c_n's leader.
During o_c_n's leader's Gathering speech, they bring up a recent death in the Clan. m_c hurries the other leader along, reminding them that the other Clans don't care.
When o_c_n's leader shares their news at the Gathering, m_c repeats bits of it in a singsong.
At the Gathering, m_c asks after the health and prosperity of each leader's Clan... except o_c_n.
m_c spends {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Gathering speech making small barbs at o_c_n's leader - not enough to warrant confrontation, just enough that o_c_n's leader feels the prick.
While getting to {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} spot before beginning the Gathering, m_c steps on the tail of o_c_n's leader. m_c gives no apology for the perhaps-not-quite mistake.
When the o_c_n leader steps up to sit beside m_c at the Gathering, m_c turns {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head away pointedly.

Another Clan's leader accuses o_c_n at the Gathering of refusing to share herbs in the case of a sick kitten. m_c turns on o_c_n's leader immediately, hissing that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} cannot ally {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with fox-hearts.
o_c_n's medicine cats present a new prophecy at the Gathering. m_c offends o_c_n by interrupting to offer {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} interpretation before the medicine cats can say anything else.

Before the Gathering, m_c has a fleeting vision of gnashing teeth and coarse black-and-white fur, along with the scent of o_c_n and blood. At the Gathering, m_c jokes that o_c_n is really badgering c_n about this alliance. o_c_n's leader's face darkens.

At the Gathering, m_c remarks on how o_c_n might need some nest-weaving tips from c_n, since o_c_n is still making nests from crabgrass and dandelion leaves. To no cat's surprise, o_c_n's leader takes offense at that.

At the Gathering, o_c_n's leader reports that one of their cats' broken bones has finally healed. m_c scoffs and addresses the o_c_n medicine cats, telling them that they should have re-broken the bone and set it better.

At the Gathering, o_c_n's leader vents to m_c about how o_c_n apprentices don't help out enough around camp. m_c scoffs, saying {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} would never permit such unruly behavior, because camp-keeping is a fundamental part of c_n apprenticeship.
m_c grins as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/spout/spouts} insults at o_c_n's leader during the Gathering.

Cats tend to let their guards down around m_c due to {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} quiet nature, which allows {PRONOUN/m_c/object} to notice the few o_c_n warriors who scowl whenever their leader speaks at the Gathering. m_c brings this up to o_c_n's leader and asks if they need help controlling their warriors.

m_c is intentional with {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} comments during the Gathering. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/manage/manages} to make it clear to o_c_n that c_n is no longer their ally - without being outright insulting.
During the Gathering, m_c is constantly singing o_c_n's praises. The other leaders don't seem so impressed, but o_c_n's leader is quite pleased.
Before the Gathering officially starts, o_c_n's leader and m_c bend their heads together to gossip like starlings.
At the Gathering, m_c goes on and on about a small favor that o_c_n did for c_n. o_c_n's leader beams.
At the Gathering, o_c_n's leader discusses a problem with a dog near their border. m_c is quick to volunteer c_n's warriors as reinforcement, should the need arise.

At the Gathering, m_c shares a dream {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} had the previous night about o_c_n and c_n thriving and strengthening each other. o_c_n's leader amazedly reports they had the exact same dream.
At the Gathering, o_c_n's leader grouses about disobedient apprentices. m_c urges them to lay down the code and keep them in line.

At the Gathering, o_c_n's leader speaks at length about the perseverance of one of their medicine cats in caring for a seriously injured Clanmate. m_c feels it would be too awkward to congratulate o_c_n directly, but nevertheless nods to the medicine cat in question.

At the Gathering, o_c_n's leader mentions a battle o_c_n warriors won against a local rogue gang. m_c makes a glowing comparison between those warriors and legendary heroes of o_c_n myth. o_c_n's leader is pleased and impressed by m_c's knowledge.

At the Gathering, m_c fills the ears of o_c_n's leader with flattering rhetoric about how c_n could enable o_c_n to dominate the territories. o_c_n's leader listens attentively, but never notices the shadow flickering behind m_c, too dark to be cast by the moon's light.

While trying to scramble up onto the leader's perch at the Gathering, o_c_n's new young leader slips and scrabbles with their hindlegs for purchase. Thinking fast, m_c grabs their scruff and lifts them onto the perch easily. o_c_n's leader breathlessly thanks {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
At the Gathering, m_c tells o_c_n's leader that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/think/thinks} o_c_n looks stronger than ever.
m_c takes {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} chance at the Gathering to fawn over o_c_n's leader for everything from their apprentices' manners to their medicine cats' intelligence.
When o_c_n arrives at the Gathering, m_c notices that o_c_n's deputy is leading the patrol instead of their leader. m_c is the first to wish o_c_n's leader a speedy recovery, and the deputy smiles.
At the Gathering, o_c_n's leader proudly announces they have welcomed new kits. m_c congratulates them first and wishes for the health and happiness of both the parents and the litter.
At the Gathering, m_c informs o_c_n's leader that c_n apprentices idolize o_c_n warriors.
During the Gathering, m_c's is the first and loudest laugh whenever o_c_n's leader makes anything even approaching a joke.

During the Gathering, m_c comments that the spirit of one of o_c_n's warriors came to {PRONOUN/m_c/object} to tell {PRONOUN/m_c/object} what a great job o_c_n's leader is doing. m_c avoids mentioning the shadows gathered like cobwebs on the spirit's pelt.
m_c compliments o_c_n's newest warriors at the Gathering.

Before the Gathering, m_c takes o_c_n's leader aside and warns them that their mate will be caught in a flood in the next moon, unless o_c_n's leader moves their camp to high ground. o_c_n's leader is shocked and grateful for m_c's clairvoyance.

Before the Gathering, m_c murmurs to o_c_n's leader that in the next moon, another Clan will suffer a greencough outbreak. This could make a great opportunity for o_c_n and c_n to seize some more territory and split it between them.
At the Gathering, m_c praises o_c_n's leader for how sharp o_c_n warriors' claws are, be it for hunting or fighting. o_c_n's leader is all the more pleased to hear that from a leader like m_c.

m_c realizes the full moon has risen and {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Gathering patrol is still in camp. m_c leads c_n in a wild sprint to the meeting place, where o_c_n's leader has convinced the others to wait. m_c thanks them profusely, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} fur sticking up in all directions.

At the Gathering, m_c remarks that o_c_n is on its way to rivaling c_n. o_c_n's leader purrs, knowing m_c's reputation for having a bit of an ego; this is as flattering a comparison as they could ask for.
m_c admits to o_c_n's leader at the Gathering that they're exactly the sort of leader {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/hope/hopes} to be.

Given o_c_n's reputation of battle-readiness, m_c decides to praise the power and strength of o_c_n's warriors at the Gathering. The appreciative gleam in o_c_n's leader's eye suggests this was the right course of action.

Given o_c_n's reputation of warm-hearted sociability, m_c decides to praise the wisdom and rationality of o_c_n's mediators at the Gathering. The appreciative gleam in o_c_n's leader's eye suggests this was the right course of action.

Given o_c_n's reputation of cool pragmatism, m_c decides to praise the intelligence and skill of o_c_n's medicine cats at the Gathering. The appreciative gleam in o_c_n's leader's eye suggests this was the right course of action.

Another leader during the Gathering makes scathing comments towards o_c_n. m_c skillfully redirects their words into praise for o_c_n; o_c_n's leader sends an appreciative, though appraising, glance to m_c.
Another leader during the Gathering makes scathing comments towards o_c_n. m_c skillfully redirects their words into praise for o_c_n; o_c_n's leader seems appreciative.

At the Gathering, m_c tells the story of a Clan that supported another through the darkest time in their shared history - even to great personal cost. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/announce/announces} that just like the mythical Clan, c_n will never abandon their ally.

At the Gathering, m_c approaches o_c_n's leader and pays them a heartfelt compliment. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} may not be a cat of many words, but when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/use/uses} them, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/make/makes} them count.

At the Gathering, m_c announces that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/believe/believes} StarClan intends for o_c_n and c_n warriors to go on a quest together. o_c_n's leader is surprised, but agrees to send out a joint patrol to explore this possibility.

m_c speaks to {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Clanmates before the Gathering, making it clear what tonight's goal is. When c_n arrives at the Gathering place, they all disperse to find o_c_n cats and take advantage of their prideful nature.
m_c makes a point to praise o_c_n's strong and mighty warriors during the Gathering.
During the Gathering, m_c has a lot to say about o_c_n's recent patrols near c_n borders, and none of it is good.
During the Gathering, m_c goes on and on about a tiny incident on the border c_n and o_c_n share, really making a prophecy out of a pawprint. o_c_n's leader seems increasingly irritable.
At the Gathering, m_c greets o_c_n's leader with a sneer and nothing else. o_c_n's leader says nothing, but their hackles rise.
o_c_n and c_n arrive at the Gathering at the same time. m_c ignores o_c_n's leader's greeting and enters the meeting place first without a backward glance.

Every cat always told m_c {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} would get in trouble for {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} smart mouth... but no cat could've predicted how useful it would be in this situation. By the end of the Gathering, o_c_n's leader seems ready to claw {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} face off.
As o_c_n's leader announces new apprentices at the Gathering, m_c interrupts to offer plenty of unsolicited advice about how best to train an apprentice.

During the Gathering, m_c sits apart from the other leaders and watches the sky. When {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/notice/notices} a wisp of cloud drift over the full moon, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/interrupt/interrupts} and {VERB/m_c/warn/warns} that StarClan is displeased - in the middle of o_c_n's leader's speech.
At the Gathering, m_c accuses o_c_n's leader of using loners and rogues to spy on c_n.

During the Gathering, m_c says nothing to the other leaders all night, until the end of the Gathering - at which point {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/gaze/gazes} dreamily into the distance and {VERB/m_c/warn/warns} o_c_n's leader that a storm in brewing for their Clan in the coming moon.
At the Gathering, m_c refuses to leave enough space on the leader's perch for o_c_n's leader, forcing them to deliver their Clan news from an awkward spot closer to the ground.
While o_c_n's leader discusses serious threats on o_c_n's border at the Gathering, m_c scoffs and shoots disbelieving looks at other leaders.
m_c responds to everything o_c_n's leader says at the Gathering with a skeptical look and an undermining comment.
At the Gathering, m_c gossips on the leader's perch about o_c_n before they arrive. When o_c_n's leader arrives and joins them on the leader's perch, the other leaders keep their distance.
When o_c_n's leader announces new warriors at the Gathering, m_c is pointedly silent while the others cheer and welcome the new warriors.

During the Gathering, o_c_n's leader delivers their news of a border skirmish. m_c grumbles under {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} breath about lazy, undisciplined fighting styles, and how o_c_n's warriors can hardly be called warriors at all.
During the Gathering, m_c makes a surprise outburst about how o_c_n has had the other Clans under their paw for far too long, and it's time for c_n and their allies to rise up against o_c_n.
During the Gathering, m_c spits accusations at o_c_n's leader.
During the Gathering, m_c comments unprompted that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} could easily take on two o_c_n warriors at once in a fight.
During the Gathering, m_c 'jokes' that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} probably caught more prey this moon than all of o_c_n combined.
During the Gathering, m_c comments that it's a pity to see what has become of o_c_n in recent moons. They used to be such a well-respected Clan...
During the Gathering, o_c_n's leader announces the birth of new kits. m_c implies that o_c_n warriors are not fit to be parents, drawing hisses and caterwauls from o_c_n.
During the Gathering, m_c asks o_c_n's leader earnestly if they really think they're living up to o_c_n's legacy. o_c_n's leader frowns at the implication.

During the Gathering, o_c_n's leader brags about recent successes in border skirmishes. m_c remarks that they're obfuscating how badly wounded some warriors are and how overworked their medicine cats seem.
During the Gathering, m_c brings up a shameful piece of o_c_n's past at an inopportune moment, much to the annoyance of o_c_n's leader.

During the Gathering, m_c launches accusations at o_c_n warriors of prey-stealing. The o_c_n warriors below howl their outrage, and o_c_n's leader tries to interrupt m_c, but {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/bluster/blusters} on, ignoring them
During the Gathering, o_c_n's leader references an o_c_n myth. m_c jumps to the end of the story and remarks on what a mouse-brain a cat would have to be to believe it.
At the Gathering, m_c makes a comparison between the story of a misbehaving c_n apprentice and o_c_n's behavior at their shared border. o_c_n's leader hisses at the implication
Knowing how o_c_n values strength in battle, m_c weaves some innocent remarks about how mouse-hearted o_c_n's newest apprentices seem. o_c_n's leader's claws slide out.

Knowing how o_c_n values good manners and strong inter-Clan relationships, m_c comments on how difficult of a time o_c_n seems to be having when it comes to controlling their misbehaving apprentices. o_c_n's leader's eyes narrow.
Knowing how o_c_n prides itself on being a clever, discerning Clan, m_c brings up recent rogue activity that o_c_n's leader has failed to take action on. The fur along o_c_n's leader's spine rises.

m_c was told {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} too smart for {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} own good. But when the goal is getting under another cat's fur, m_c is exactly the right cat for the task. This Gathering is very productive; o_c_n's leader is spitting by the end.

Being a quiet observer means m_c notices things other cats don't - such as the tense looks between o_c_n's leader and deputy. In the middle of the Gathering, m_c pipes up and asks if something's wrong in o_c_n's leadership, blinking innocently at them.

At the Gathering, dark whispers rush through m_c's voice like a cold wind through dead branches. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/warn/warns} o_c_n that they are making an enemy of c_n - and it could be their last mistake.
During the Gathering, m_c does {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} best to get on o_c_n's good side.

It occurs to m_c at the Gathering that o_c_n has never been on good terms with one other Clan. m_c spends {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} speech making veiled insults at that Clan, all the while cozying up to o_c_n's leader.
c_n and o_c_n arrive at the Gathering's meeting place at the same time; m_c halts the Clan with a tail-signal and gestures for o_c_n's leader to enter first.
During the Gathering, m_c nods and agrees when o_c_n's leader mentions diplomacy and inter-Clan friendship.
At the Gathering, m_c nudges {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Clanmates to go sit with o_c_nners and chat with them.
When o_c_n arrives at the Gathering, m_c shifts over to make plenty of room for their leader on the leader's perch. o_c_n's leader jumps up and dips their head to m_c.
During the Gathering, o_c_n's leader announces new warriors. m_c leads c_n in cheering their names.
During the Gathering, o_c_n's leader describes driving off some troublesome rogues. m_c nods {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} approval.
At the Gathering, m_c asks o_c_n's leader a few questions about themselves.
During the Gathering, m_c remarks that o_c_n's apprentices seem to be growing into fine young cats.
m_c takes o_c_n's leader aside at the Gathering to ask about resolving a particular dispute in c_n. o_c_n's leader, flattered, gives {PRONOUN/m_c/object} plenty of advice.
During the Gathering, m_c surprises and impresses o_c_n's leader by bringing up an obscure part of o_c_n's history.

The night before the Gathering, one of m_c's friends visits {PRONOUN/m_c/object} from StarClan and gives {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a pep talk, reminding {PRONOUN/m_c/object} what a good friend {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is}. m_c arrives at the Gathering with steeled nerves and strikes up conversation with o_c_n's leader

m_c brings a piece of willow bark with strange grooves on it to the Gathering. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/explain/explains} to the other leaders that this is a sign of future prosperity for o_c_n and c_n - and only them.
During the Gathering, m_c brings up an old legend about two Clans that put aside their differences and formed an alliance, bringing strength to both of them. o_c_n's leader listens with interest.

At the Gathering, m_c pulls o_c_n's leader aside to warn them that fire may be a problem for o_c_n in the coming moons. o_c_n's leader seems skeptical as to how m_c could possibly know that, but nevertheless thanks {PRONOUN/m_c/object} for the heads-up.
At the Gathering, m_c pulls o_c_n's leader aside to warn them that a large dog may be a problem for o_c_n in the coming moons. o_c_n's leader agrees to be careful, thanking m_c for the heads-up.

At the Gathering, o_c_n's leader struggles through a report that an entire litter of o_c_n kits were wiped out by kitten-cough. m_c draws them aside after and reassures them that the kittens are playing moss-ball together in StarClan. o_c_n's leader thanks {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, their mew thick with emotion.
During the Gathering, m_c flatters o_c_n's leader with {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} attention. After all, m_c knows exactly how to handle short tempers and immature behavior.

m_c may be awkward with cats {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} age, but some things about socializing are true for all ages. At the Gathering, m_c expresses interest in all of o_c_n's leader's comments and opinions, and by the end of the night, o_c_n's leader has puffed up their chest.

At the Gathering, m_c sympathizes with o_c_n's leader about the pressures of leading a Clan. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/suggest/suggests} going out for solo night hunts from time to time - that's always worked for m_c

At the Gathering, o_c_n's leader announces the birth of new o_c_n kits. m_c assures them with blazing eyes that c_n will always help defend those too young to defend themselves, and o_c_n's leader gives {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a grateful nod.

During the Gathering, o_c_n's leader wearily reports how o_c_n kits keep sneaking out of camp. m_c pulls them aside after and suggests that bringing the kits onto the territory in supervised groups might help regulate all that kithood energy. o_c_n's leader is impressed and thanks m_c for the suggestion.

During the Gathering, o_c_n's leader comments to the other leaders that their apprentices are struggling to learn to swim. m_c snorts that most mentors forget to teach apprentices to blow bubbles first. Embarrassed, o_c_n's leader admits they had forgotten and thanks m_c for the reminder.

At the Gathering, o_c_n's leader reports the tragic death of a kit who was killed by a snake in the nursery. m_c pulls them aside after to offer condolences, and suggests weaving basil and marigold into the nursery wall as a deterrent.

During the Gathering, o_c_n's leader gets into a tense debate with another leader. m_c waits until they've reached an impasse, then offers a softspoken solution that satisfies both of them. o_c_n's leader shoots {PRONOUN/m_c/object} an appreciative look.

At the Gathering, m_c points out a constellation of stars to o_c_n's leader that almost form the very thing that o_c_n was named for. o_c_n's leader agrees with a purr, remarking that they had never noticed it.
At the Gathering, m_c jokes about what a pain in the tail it can be to lead a Clan. o_c_n's leader agrees with a purr.
At the Gathering, m_c takes a chance and confides in o_c_n's leader about a problem plaguing c_n. o_c_n's leader is both sympathetic and flattered to be trusted.

At the Gathering, m_c remarks to o_c_n's leader that each member of o_c_n is like a tiny chitinous thread and, woven together, they form the wings of a beautiful butterfly. o_c_n's leader isn't certain what m_c means by that, but appreciates the sentiment.
m_c sidles up to the o_c_n leader during the Gathering and navigates the ensuing conversation with ease. The two seem to be good friends by the end of it.
During the Gathering, m_c mentions StarClan's signs of favor toward o_c_n, irritating one of the other deeply faithful leaders. In the ensuing tensions, m_c offers c_n's support to o_c_n's leader.
m_c sidles up to the o_c_n leader during the Gathering and {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} charming nature makes friendship a simple matter.
At the Gathering, m_c goes out on a limb and admits to o_c_n's leader that their deceased parent is still hovering by them in spirit. o_c_n's leader bows their head, too overcome to speak.

At the Gathering, m_c remarks on how a fighting technique developed by o_c_n warriors is something m_c hopes to teach to c_n's apprentices for moons to come. o_c_n's leader is impressed and flattered.

At the Gathering, m_c thinks about how making friends is a lot like hunting - it's all a matter of approaching at the best angle, timing it right, and then pouncing. By the end of the night, o_c_n's leader is on c_n's fresh-kill pile... metaphorically.
During the Gathering, m_c catches the eye of the o_c_n leader. The two regard each other carefully and, later on, the other leader makes an offer of friendship.
o_c_n's leader is loud and threatening at the Gathering. m_c holds {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} ground and shows no fear, earning a look of respect from the other leader.
During the Gathering, m_c has nothing but sharp comments and sarcastic quips to add whenever o_c_n's leader speaks.
When o_c_n's leader makes an appeal to m_c at the Gathering, m_c shuts them down with a sneer.

When o_c_n's leader insults m_c at the Gathering, m_c replies that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} used to handling immature, childish behavior - but this is a lot, even for {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
At the Gathering, m_c roars that StarClan themselves have ordained c_n's position as the mightiest Clan. No cat - not o_c_n's leader, nor all their warriors - can get in the way of c_n's destiny.
At the Gathering, m_c insists on speaking first and makes it clear that peace cannot thrive between o_c_n and c_n. Not until o_c_n pays for what they have done.
o_c_n's leader may be the first to launch a threat at the Gathering, but m_c matches each one with three more.
At the Gathering, o_c_n and c_n sit far apart. Shouting insults and threats is best done from a distance, especially when a truce is meant to be respected.
m_c makes it {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} personal mission during the Gathering to see how close {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can come to making o_c_n's leader break the truce.
m_c barely brings up c_n's news during {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Gathering speech - {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} too busy sniping at o_c_n.
During the Gathering, m_c calls out specific o_c_n warriors by name and insults them, all the while ignoring o_c_n's leader.
At the Gathering, m_c invents incidents of border crossings and prey-stealing that never happened, just to further poison the stream between o_c_n and c_n.
At the Gathering, m_c tells o_c_n's leader to their face that they're a good-for-nothing fox-heart. Sometimes the direct approach is best.

At the Gathering, o_c_n's leader takes up all the air in the meeting place snarling insults and threats. m_c waits for {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} moment before coolly delivering a single devastating verbal blow.
m_c spends the Gathering making thinly veiled comments about o_c_n's hunting abilities. By the end of it, the proud o_c_n leader is visibly annoyed.

m_c flexes {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} claws in front of o_c_n's leader at the Gathering and asks if they ever wish o_c_n had a fighter as talented as {PRONOUN/m_c/object}. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} rewarded for {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} insolence with a hiss of outrage from o_c_n's leader.

o_c_n's leader reports at the Gathering that some of their warriors led an uprising and had to be put down. m_c scoffs, unsheathes {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} claws, and announces {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}'d rebel against o_c_n's leader too, if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} were one of o_c_n's warriors.
At the Gathering, m_c spreads the rumor that o_c_n thinks bracken is good enough to reinforce den walls. Somehow, this cuts deep.
